page.title: 09The Rangemore Club
page.content: In the block there are no public houses, but there is a{Club}situated in{Rangemore}village. It was built in 1886 by the first Lord Burton as a Social Club and Reading Room, and was sold to the members in 1957 for a nominal sum. A{committee}ensures that a high standard is maintained. There are{387 members}who pay Â£2 (single membership) or Â£3 (joint membership). The Club opens between 7.00 and 11.00 p.m. daily and 12.00 and 2.00 p.m. at weekends. Members can play{darts, dominoes, {snooker and bingo,}and there is entertainment by local groups fortnightly.{It is a licensed club}and sells beer by{Marstons of Burton.} There are 2 darts teams, and the village football and cricket teams, the Over-60's club, and the Royal British Legion meet here regularly.
